definition: to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: There was a few minutes that the aircraft was down down and feeling like free-fall.
sentences.chinese: 有一阵子一直往下掉，感觉就像自由落体一样。

sentences.english: Only when it looks down and notices it, it falls down.
sentences.chinese: 当它往下看，注意到了，便开始了自由落体。

sentences.english: You are now weightless, you are free-falling.
sentences.chinese: 此刻失重，自由落体运动。

sentences.english: Water and falling fruit are fast.
sentences.chinese: 水花四溅和自由落体的水果是很快速的。

sentences.english: Yet credit remains scarce, and the economy is still in free fall.
sentences.chinese: 然而，信贷依然匮乏，经济仍处于自由落体状态。

sentences.english: This is the plane while it is in free fall.
sentences.chinese: 这就是在自由落体的飞机。

sentences.english: Walk past the big Tower Free- fall Ride and the roller coaster will be on your left.
sentences.chinese: 穿过桥，走过自由落体乘车塔，过山车就在你的左边。

sentences.english: Today, her world ranking has dropped to as the first free-falling , such as 99.
sentences.chinese: 如今，她的世界排名已经如自由落体般跌至第99位。

sentences.english: Wu Juping's bare handed catch absorbed the impact of Niu's freefall.
sentences.chinese: 吴菊萍徒手去接妞妞缓解了她自由落体时的冲击力。

definition: to dive down fast/to swoop down
to slide/to coast/to glide/(of an aircraft) to taxi
to rise/to ascend/to climb (airplane etc)/to go up (sales figures etc)/to gain promotion
